bookText.htmlContent: Goblins or goblinoids comprise of several varieties of strangely human-like species. The most notable characteristics are their elogated or snout-like noses, animalistic eyes, and large bat-like ears. Typical goblins are short, hairless and have a prominent nose. The taller hobgoblins have flatter, cat-like facial features, while bugbears are the largest varienty, with beast-like facial features and a covering of thick fur.

Depending on who you ask, goblins and goblinoids are either untrustworthy vandals, or skilled, dedicated tinkerers. Their great proficiency with mechanical and alchemical processes often get finds them steady work, if the common compulsion to wild experimentation doesn't get them out of it later. While individually they tend to be selfish and craven, groups of goblins are capable of great coordination while working towards a common goal. With their strange appearance, short stature and high fertility, they are often unfavorably likened to common imps.

Unlike humans, goblinoids are heavily affected by arcane storms. Goblins enter a potent rut or heat, and feel a strong urge to breed with complete strangers. With their heightened libidos and fertility, goblinoid populations tend to experience sporadic booms after storms.
